page.title: 03Housing in the Felton Area
page.content: The majority of houses are of red brick but many are also of stone, or of black and white timber and plaster. Roofs are mainly slate, and all have septic tanks which the owners are responsible for emptying. The majority have mains electricity and water although a proportion still have their own wells. Most houses have large gardens. Houses are either owner-occupied, rented, or tied to a farm - the latter being in the minority. Rented houses belong either to the local authority or to private landlords. Services available to all properties are postal, telephone, bus, milk delivery, bread delivery and the mobile library. Rates are paid to the Malvern Hills District Council. A few houses have been bought for use as holiday homes, and others are rented out as holiday cottages or flats.
